page.title: 02BRENT KNOLL REST AREA-M5
page.content: THE REST AREA WAS OPENED IN 1980.FOLLOWING THE COMPLETION OF THE M5 BETWEEN JUNCTION 19 AND JUNCTION 25.(BRISTOL TO TAUNTON). AT FIRST IT OFFERED SIMPLY A SPACE WHERE DRIVERS COULD STOP AND REST.MOBILE TOILETS WERE PROVIDED.SINCE THEN THE SITES HAVE DEVELOPED ON BOTH NORTH AND SOUTH ROUTES.CAFE'S SUPPLY A FULL RANGE OF FOOD ALTHOUGH VARIETY IS LIMITED.FULLY EQUIPPED TOILET BLOCKS ARE NOW IN USE.IN ADDITION THERE ARE MOBILE SUPPLIERS OF FRUIT AND REFRESHMENTS. CARAVANS AND LORRIES CAN NOW PARK OVERNIGHT FOR A SMALL CHARGE THE SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC CAN MAKE USE OF AN INFORMATION OFFICE. PLANS EXIST TO CONVERT THIS REST AREA INTO A FULL SERVICE AREA.
